Defines the scoring approach used. Possible options:
'exactMatch': Exact Match - Entire response must match exactly
'partialMatchV2': Partial Match - A relative part of the score will be given for each correct response area
'partialMatch': Partial Match per response - Cumulative Score value will be given for each correct response area
When enabled, this option will remove all scoring from the question. This is useful for creating practice questions.

help.bowtie.description:validation.penal: Value indicating the marks deducted for an incorrect response.
help.bowtie.description:validation.round: Method for rounding the score after it has been calculated as a fraction of score. none: No rounding applied, floor: Rounded down to the nearest whole number.
help.bowtie.description:validation.scori:
The way in which marks are distributed for the question.
  • Exact Match - All parts of the question must be answered correctly to receive a mark.
  • Partial Match Per Cell - Each correct cell will be scored will be awarded an individual score.
  • Partial Match Per Cell - Max Score - Each correct cell will be scored individually, and the overall question score will be divided between cells.
  • Partial match Per Element - Each correct response element will be awarded an individual score.
  • Partial Match per Element V2 - Each correct response element will be scored individually, and the overall question score will be divided between responses.

Keyboard style. See Keypad Customisation for more information. Possible values:
  • "floating-keyboard"

    A movable keypad appears when the learner brings focus into the response box

  • "block-keyboard"

    A fixed keypad that is always visible

  • "block-on-focus-keyboard"

    A fixed keypad appears when the learner brings focus into the response box

  • "no-input-ui"

    No keypad

When enabled, this will position the floating keyboard below the last line of the response area. Otherwise, this will partially overlap the response area.
Controls the minimum width of the response input area, e.g. 550px

This scales the font relative to the question's font size. Possible values:
  • "boosted" 150%
  • "normal" 100%

Keyboard style. See Keypad Customization for more information. Possible values:
  • "floating-keyboard"

    A movable keypad appears when the learner brings focus into the response box

  • "block-keyboard"

    A fixed keypad that is always visible

  • "block-on-focus-keyboard"

    A fixed keypad appears when the learner brings focus into the response box

  • "no-input-ui"

    No keypad
Numeration character to be displayed to the left of the validation label.
help.clozeformulaV2.description:validati: In this section, configure the correct answer(s) for the question.

Method for rounding the score after it has been calculated as a fraction of score. none: No rounding applied, floor: Rounded down to the nearest whole number.

The way in which marks are distributed for the question. Possible options:
'exactMatch': Exact Match - All parts of the question must be answered correctly to receive a mark.
'partialMatchV2': Partial Match - Each correct response element will be scored individually, and the overall question score will be divided between the responses.
'partialMatch': Partial Match per Response - Each correct response element will be awarded an individual score.
When enabled, this option will remove all scoring from the question. This is useful for creating practice questions.

help.clozetext.description:: Cloze question type with text inputs.
help.clozetext.description:case_sensitiv: If true, responses will be compared against valid_responses considering the letters' case.
help.clozetext.description:character_map:
If true, the character map button will display within the short text field. The character map will display the default set of special characters.
If an Array, the character map button will show and display only the array of characters.
IMPORTANT The HTML document will require a charset of utf-8: <meta charset="utf-8">
help.clozetext.description:description:
Deprecated See stimulus_review.
Description of the question and its context to be displayed. It supports HTML entities.
help.clozetext.description:feedback_atte: If instant_feedback is true, this field determines how many times the user can click on the 'Check Answer' button. 0 means unlimited.
help.clozetext.description:ignore_leadin: Determines whether the automatic marking will ignore leading and trailing spaces. E.g. 'a' and ' a ' will be treated as the same.
help.clozetext.description:instant_feedb: Flag to determine whether to display a 'Check Answer' button to provide instant feedback to the user.
help.clozetext.description:instructor_st: HTML/Text content displayed when showInstructorStimulus is set to true on the activity. Supports embedded Feature <span> tags.
help.clozetext.description:is_math: Set to true to have LaTeX or MathML contents to be rendered with mathjax.
help.clozetext.description:max_length: Maximum number of characters that can be entered in the field. Maximum value is 250. For longer questions use longtext type.
help.clozetext.description:metadata.ackn: References for any text passages, documents, images etc. used in the question.
help.clozetext.description:metadata.dist: Used to display individual response feedback/rationale to the student.
help.clozetext.description:metadata.rubr: A unique identifier for the rubric to be used with the question - defaults to course rubric if assigned in activity
help.clozetext.description:metadata.samp: A sample answer to be displayed on the Learnosity Reports API. HTML is supported.
help.clozetext.description:multiple_line: If true the response input will be a text area supporting multiple lines of input. If false the response input will be a text input only supporting one line responses.
help.clozetext.description:response_cont: Use Response Container (global) to make changes to all response boxes at once.
Text to display as a hint to the user of what to enter
Array containing objects defining each individual response container style.
Custom aria label text for the response container.
Placeholder text that can be added into the response entry area, which disappears when user starts typing.
Array containing objects defining each individual response container style.
Custom aria label text for the response container.
Placeholder text that can be added into the response entry area, which disappears when user starts typing.
help.clozetext.description:spellcheck: Control the input/textarea attributes spellcheck, autocapitalize, autocomplete and autocorrect. See "Spell check MDN". "Autocapitalize MDN". "Autocomplete MDN" " Autocorrect ". Note these are browser features and may not always be available.
help.clozetext.description:stimulus: The question stimulus. This can include text, tables, images, resources and LaTeX entered via the Math Editor.
help.clozetext.description:stimulus_revi: HTML/Text content displayed only in review state rendered above the response area. Supports embedded Feature <span> tags. Will override stimulus in review state.
help.clozetext.description:template: Text, tables, images and response boxes can be added to this area. Click on the Insert Response button in the Rich Text Editor to add a response box, or press the underscore button on your keyboard twice as a shortcut.
help.clozetext.description:ui_style.font: Controls the size of base font for this question. Options are among 'small', 'normal', 'large', 'xlarge' and 'xxlarge'.
help.clozetext.description:ui_style.vali: Numeration character to be displayed to the left of the validation label.
help.clozetext.description:validation: In this section, configure the correct answer(s) for the question.
help.clozetext.description:validation.al: Negative scores will be normalised to zero by default. Allowing negative scores, on the other hand, means that the score can drop below zero when penalties are applied.
Add an alternate response if there is more than one correct overall solution to a question.
Score if the alternative response is correct.
Add an alternate response if there is more than one correct overall solution to a question.
Score if the alternative response is correct.
help.clozetext.description:validation.au: Defines whether the question will be marked automatically, or must be marked manually.
help.clozetext.description:validation.en: For languages such as Japanese, where full-width and half-width characters are used, validate responses with either type of character width. For example, in this question: What do we call '' in English? And you have set '' (full-width) as the correct answer, if the learner enters '' (full-width) or 'Dog' (half-width) these will both be marked as correct responses when this option is enabled.
help.clozetext.description:validation.ma: If true, the responses will be matched against all combinations of valid and alternate responses for the response position. Otherwise, responses will be scored from the valid responses, or one of the alternate responses, but never a combination of them.
The highest score a marker can award to this question response.
help.clozetext.description:validation.mi: Positive value indicating the minimum score if a student attempted the question.
help.clozetext.description:validation.pe: Value indicating the marks deducted for an incorrect response.
help.clozetext.description:validation.ro: Method for rounding the score after it has been calculated as a fraction of score. none: No rounding applied, floor: Rounded down to the nearest whole number.
help.clozetext.description:validation.sc:
Defines the scoring approach used. Possible options:
'exactMatch': Exact Match - Entire response must match exactly
'partialMatchV2': Partial Match - A relative part of the score will be given for each correct response area
'partialMatch': Partial Match per response - Cumulative Score value will be given for each correct response area
help.clozetext.description:validation.un: When enabled, this option will remove all scoring from the question. This is useful for creating practice questions.
help.clozetext.description:validation.va: An object containing the valid response score and value.
Score awarded for the correct response(s).
An array containing the valid responses for each {{response}} in the template in corresponding order.
An array containing the valid responses for each {{response}} in the template in corresponding order.
help.clozetext.name:validation.enable_fu: Enable full or half-width character scoring
help.drawing.description:: Drawing question type that allows students to use multiple drawing tools such as compass, straightedge to answer question
help.drawing.description:character_map:
The character map will display the default set of special characters.
If an Array, the character map button will show and display only the array of characters.
IMPORTANTThe HTML document will require a charset of utf-8: <meta charset="utf-8">
help.drawing.description:drawing_tools: Select tools to toggle them on or off. Drag them to rearrange toolbar order
help.drawing.description:drawing_tools[*: Select tools to toggle them on or off. Drag them to rearrange toolbar order
help.drawing.description:image: The absolute URL of the background image.
help.drawing.description:image.alt: Alternative text that appears when the image cannot be rendered, and is used for accessibility purposes such as screen readers.
help.drawing.description:image.height: Enter a numeric value for the height of the image. This value should be a pixel (px) value, but you do not need to type px into the field.
help.drawing.description:image.preview: Preview of the chosen image, or of the selected background
help.drawing.description:image.source: The image that should be displayed.
help.drawing.description:image.width: Enter a numeric value for the width of the image. This value should be a pixel (px) value, but you do not need to type px into the field.
help.drawing.description:instructor_stim: HTML/Text content displayed when showInstructorStimulus is set to true on the activity. Supports embedded Feature <span> tags.
help.drawing.description:is_math: Set to true to have LaTeX or MathML contents to be rendered with mathjax.
help.drawing.description:line_color: Defines the colour and opacity of the drawn line.
help.drawing.description:line_color[*]: Defines the colour and opacity of the drawn line.
help.drawing.description:line_width: Width of the painted line, in pixels.
help.drawing.description:metadata.acknow: References for any text passages, documents, images etc. used in the question.
help.drawing.description:metadata.distra: Used to display individual response feedback/rationale to the student.
Used to store the distractor rationales that map to responses in the same order for use/rendering by the host environment.
Used to store the distractor rationales that map to responses in the same order for use/rendering by the host environment.
help.drawing.description:metadata.rubric: A unique identifier for the rubric to be used with the question - defaults to course rubric if assigned in activity
help.drawing.description:metadata.sample: A sample answer to be displayed on the Learnosity Reports API. HTML is supported.
help.drawing.description:spellcheck: Enable or disable browser spellcheck, autocapitalize, autocomplete and autocorrect attributes on the user response area.
help.drawing.description:stimulus: The question stimulus. This can include text, tables, images, resources and LaTeX entered via the Math Editor.
help.drawing.description:stimulus_review: HTML/Text content displayed only in review state rendered above the response area. Supports embedded Feature <span> tags. Will override stimulus in review state.
help.drawing.description:text_formatting: Select Text formating tools under the Text tool.
Select Text formating tools under the Text tool.
help.drawing.description:ui_style.fontsi: Controls the size of base font for this question. Options are among 'small', 'normal', 'large', 'xlarge' and 'xxlarge'.
help.drawing.description:validation: In this section, configure the correct answer(s) for the question.
help.drawing.description:validation.max_: The highest score a marker can award to this question response.
help.drawing.description:validation.min_: Positive value indicating the minimum score if a student attempted the question.
help.drawing.description:validation.unsc: When enabled, this option will remove all scoring from the question. This is useful for creating practice questions.
help.fileupload.description:: Users can upload files from their device.
help.fileupload.description:allow_ai: Allow the student to upload Adobe Illustrator (.ai) files.
help.fileupload.description:allow_altera: Allow the student to upload Quartus file types including: bdf, bsf.
help.fileupload.description:allow_assemb: Allow the student to upload .asm files.
help.fileupload.description:allow_c: Allow the student to upload .c files.
help.fileupload.description:allow_cpp: Allow the student to upload .cpp files.

help.fileupload.description:allow_gif: Allow the student to upload .gif files.

help.fileupload.description:allow_jpg: Allow the student to upload .jpg files.
help.fileupload.description:allow_labvie: Allow the student to upload LabVIEW virtual instrument (.vi) files.
help.fileupload.description:allow_matlab: Allow the student to upload MATLAB file types including: m, fig, mat.
help.fileupload.description:allow_ms_exc: Allow the student to upload Microsoft Excel file types including: xls, xlsx, xlt, xltm, xlsm.
help.fileupload.description:allow_ms_pow: Allow the student to upload Microsoft Powerpoint file types including: ppt, pps, pot, pptx, pptm, potx, potm, ppsx, ppsm.
help.fileupload.description:allow_ms_pub: Allow the student to upload Microsoft Publisher files.
help.fileupload.description:allow_ms_wor: Allow the student to upload Microsoft Word file types including: doc, docx, dot, dotx, docm, dotm.
help.fileupload.description:allow_open_o: Allow the student to upload Open Office file types including: odf, odt, ods, odp.
help.fileupload.description:allow_pdf: Allow the student to upload .pdf files.
help.fileupload.description:allow_png: Allow the student to upload .png files.
help.fileupload.description:allow_psd: Allow the student to upload Adobe Photoshop (.psd) files.
help.fileupload.description:allow_rtf: Allow the student to upload .rtf files.

Defines whether the question will be marked automatically, or must be marked manually.

When set to 'yes', scoring will ignore shapes which are plotted multiple times within the same composition (authored value is treated separately to student's response). When the value is set to 'strict', the shapes are only considered equal if the points are equivalent, not just the position and slope. See the knowledgebase article for more details: http://docs.learnosity.com/assessment/questions/knowledgebase/graphplotting_ignore_repeated_shapes
The highest score a marker can award to this question response.
Positive value indicating the minimum score if a student attempted the question.
Value indicating the marks deducted for an incorrect response.
Method for rounding the score after it has been calculated as a fraction of score. none: No rounding applied, floor: Rounded down to the nearest whole number.

The way in which marks are distributed for the question.
  • Exact Match - All parts of the question must be answered correctly to receive a mark.
  • Partial Match Per Response - Each correct response element will be awarded an individual score.
  • Partial Match - Each correct response element will be scored individually, and the overall question score will be divided between responses.
When enabled, this option will remove all scoring from the question. This is useful for creating practice questions.
An object containing the valid response score and value.
Score awarded for the correct response(s).

Defines whether the question will be marked automatically, or must be marked manually.

For languages such as Japanese, where full-width and half-width characters are used, validate responses with either type of character width. For example, in this question: What do we call '' in English? And you have set '' (full-width) as the correct answer, if the learner enters '' (full-width) or 'Dog' (half-width) these will both be marked as correct responses when this option is enabled.

If true, the responses will be matched against all combinations of valid and alternate responses for the response position. Otherwise, responses will be scored from the valid responses, or one of the alternate responses, but never a combination of them.

'exactMatch': Exact Match - Entire response must match exactly
'partialMatchV2': Partial Match - A relative part of the score will be given for each correct response area
'partialMatch': Partial Match per response - Cumulative Score value will be given for each correct response area
When enabled, this option will remove all scoring from the question. This is useful for creating practice questions.

  • "vertical"
help.mcq.description:ui_style.type: Formatting styles available for the question.
help.mcq.description:ui_style.validation: Numeration characters displayed to the left of the validation label. Only visible in review state.
help.mcq.description:validation: In this section, configure the correct answer(s) for the question.
help.mcq.description:validation.allow_ne: Negative scores will be normalised to zero by default. Allowing negative scores, on the other hand, means that the score can drop below zero when penalties are applied.
help.mcq.description:validation.alt_resp: Add an alternate response if there is more than one correct overall solution to a question.
Score if the alternative response is correct.
Add an alternate response if there is more than one correct overall solution to a question.
Score if the alternative response is correct.
help.mcq.description:validation.automark: Defines whether the question will be marked automatically, or must be marked manually.
help.mcq.description:validation.max_scor: The highest score a marker can award to this question response.
help.mcq.description:validation.min_scor: Positive value indicating the minimum score if a student attempted the question.
help.mcq.description:validation.penalty: Value indicating the marks deducted for an incorrect response.
help.mcq.description:validation.rounding: Method for rounding the score after it has been calculated as a fraction of score. none: No rounding applied, floor: Rounded down to the nearest whole number.
help.mcq.description:validation.scoring_:
The way in which marks are distributed for the question.
  • Exact Match - All parts of the question must be answered correctly to receive a mark.
  • Partial Match Per Response - Each correct response element will be awarded an individual score.
  • Partial Match - Each correct response element will be scored individually, and the overall question score will be divided between responses.
help.mcq.description:validation.unscored: When enabled, this option will remove all scoring from the question. This is useful for creating practice questions.
help.mcq.description:validation.valid_re: An object containing the valid response score and value.
Score awarded for the correct response(s).
help.mcq.name:options.assistive_label.ex: Visible content is navigatable by a screen reader
help.mcq.name:options.label: Label
help.mcq.name:options[*].assistive_label: Visible content is navigatable by a screen reader
help.mcq.name:options[*].label: Label
help.multistepmath.description:: Allows multiline math input with step-by-step auto-scoring.
help.multistepmath.description:feedback_: If instant_feedback is true, this field determines how many times the user can click on the 'Check Answer' button. 0 means unlimited.
help.multistepmath.description:handwriti: A string with the name of one of the available math grammar sets.
help.multistepmath.description:horizonta: Enables a horizontal layout with ten columns and two rows.
help.multistepmath.description:instant_f: Flag to determine whether to display a 'Check Answer' button to provide instant feedback to the user.
help.multistepmath.description:instructo: HTML/Text content displayed when showInstructorStimulus is set to true on the activity. Supports embedded Feature <span> tags.
help.multistepmath.description:is_math: Set to true to have LaTeX or MathML contents to be rendered with mathjax.
References for any text passages, documents, images etc. used in the question.
Used to display individual response feedback/rationale to the student.
Used to display individual response feedback/rationale to the learner, at the relevant response level.
Used to display individual response feedback/rationale to the learner, at the relevant response level.

A sample answer to be displayed on the Learnosity Reports API. HTML is supported.
help.multistepmath.description:showHints: Disables hint, including keyboard shortcuts and group titles, shown on the keyboard's top left corner when hovering over a symbol group key.
help.multistepmath.description:stimulus: The question stimulus. This can include text, tables, images, resources and LaTeX entered via the Math Editor.
help.multistepmath.description:stimulus_: HTML/Text content displayed only in review state rendered above the response area. Supports embedded Feature <span> tags. Will override stimulus in review state.
help.multistepmath.description:text_bloc: List of custom text blocks. Maximum length 9 characters.
List of custom text blocks. Maximum length 9 characters.

Keyboard style. See Keypad Customization for more information. Possible values:

  • "block-keyboard"

    A fixed keypad that is always visible

  • "block-on-focus-keyboard"

  • "no-input-ui"

Defines whether the question will be marked automatically, or must be marked manually.

Defines the way in which feedback is provided to the student.
  • None - No feedback is provided to the student.
  • Check answer button - Enables the Check Answer button underneath the question, which will provide the student with instant feedback on their response.
  • Check answer button and automatic feedback of steps - Enables the Check Answer button underneath the question and automatic step-by-step feedback as student moves to a new line.
  • Automatic feedback of steps only - Enables automatic step-by-step feedback as student moves to a new line.

help.numberline.description:: Place points on a number line
help.numberline.description:feedback_att: If instant_feedback is true, this field determines how many times the user can click on the 'Check Answer' button. 0 means unlimited.
help.numberline.description:instant_feed: Flag to determine whether to display a 'Check Answer' button to provide instant feedback to the user.

help.numberline.description:labels: Defines the labels to draw on the number line
help.numberline.description:labels.frequ: Frequency with which to draw labels
help.numberline.description:labels.point: Specific point at which labels need to be drawn. Separate values by commas, eg: -2.5, 2.5

Whether to draw a label on the min value of the number line
help.numberline.description:line: Defines the minimum and maximum values on the number line.

help.numberline.description:points: Array containing the points the user has to position on the number line. Possible formats are: text, number, fraction and mixed fraction. The field doesn't support LaTeX because of rendering complexity.
help.numberline.description:points[*]: Array containing the points the user has to position on the number line. Possible formats are: text, number, fraction and mixed fraction. The field doesn't support LaTeX because of rendering complexity.
help.numberline.description:snap_to_tick: Whether dragged points should snap to the ticks specified by ticks.distance and labels.points
help.numberline.description:snap_vertica: Whether dragged points should snap to the line when dropped above it
help.numberline.description:stimulus: The question stimulus. This can include text, tables, images, resources and LaTeX entered via the Math Editor.
help.numberline.description:stimulus_rev: HTML/Text content displayed only in review state rendered above the response area. Supports embedded Feature <span> tags. Will override stimulus in review state.

help.numberline.description:ticks.distan: The distance between ticks on the number line

If the distance is set to a fraction this will determine in which format the fractions will be rendered on the Number Line. Select to display only:

  • Not normalized and mixed fractions.
  • Normalized and mixed fractions.
  • Improper fractions.
help.numberline.description:ticks.show: Whether to draw ticks on the line or not
help.numberline.description:ui_style.fon: Controls the size of base font for this question. Options are among 'small', 'normal', 'large', 'xlarge' and 'xxlarge'.
help.numberline.description:ui_style.hei: The height of the drawn area with trailing px unit eg. "250px". If undefined or empty, the board's height will scaled automatically based on the contents
help.numberline.description:ui_style.lin: At which percentage of the height should the Number Line appear
help.numberline.description:ui_style.num: The distance from the number line's extremes to the sides with trailing px unit e.g. "5px"
help.numberline.description:ui_style.poi: At which percentage of the height should the Points box container start

help.numberline.description:ui_style.wid: The width of the drawn area with trailing px unit eg. "550px".

The way in which marks are distributed for the question. Possible options:
'exactMatch': Exact Match - All parts of the question must be answered correctly to receive a mark.
'partialMatchV2': Partial Match - Each correct response element will be scored individually, and the overall question score will be divided between responses.
'partialMatch': Partial Match per Response - Each correct response element will be awarded an individual score.

help.simpleshading.description:canvas: Set the number of rows and columns, along with the cell width and height.
help.simpleshading.description:canvas.al: The alternative text of the shading image.
help.simpleshading.description:canvas.hi: Coordinates of the author-hidden canvas. Authors can hide certain canvas elements before the assessment begins. The value is an array of arrays that contain the coordinate row and column groups, i.e. [ [row1, column1], [row2, column2], ... ]. Note the position is an array of form [y, x] that uses 1-based indexing rather than 0-based, e.g. [1, 3] means the cell at first row, third column.

Coordinates of the author-hidden canvas. Authors can hide certain canvas elements before the assessment begins. The value is an array of arrays that contain the coordinate row and column groups, i.e. [ [row1, column1], [row2, column2], ... ]. Note the position is an array of form [y, x] that uses 1-based indexing rather than 0-based, e.g. [1, 3] means the cell at first row, third column.
help.simpleshading.description:canvas.re: Prevents user from modifying Author Shaded
help.simpleshading.description:canvas.sh: Coordinates of the author-shaded canvas. Authors can define certain canvas elements to be pre-shaded before the assessment begins. The value is an array of arrays that contain the coordinate row and column groups, i.e. [ [row1, column1], [row2, column2], ... ]. Note the position is an array of form [y, x] that uses 1-based indexing rather than 0-based, e.g. [1, 3] means the cell at first row, third column.

Coordinates of the author-shaded canvas. Authors can define certain canvas elements to be pre-shaded before the assessment begins. The value is an array of arrays that contain the coordinate row and column groups, i.e. [ [row1, column1], [row2, column2], ... ]. Note the position is an array of form [y, x] that uses 1-based indexing rather than 0-based, e.g. [1, 3] means the cell at first row, third column.

The way in which marks are distributed for the question. Possible options:
'exactMatch': Exact Match - All parts of the question must be answered correctly to receive a mark.
'partialMatchV2': Partial Match - Each correct cell will be scored individually, and the overall question score will be divided between the amount of correct cells.
When enabled, this option will remove all scoring from the question. This is useful for creating practice questions.

'byCount': value should be a number.
